caption: Table 1: Our performance on CelebA-HQ, LSUN Church, FFHQ datasets at resolution 256×256256256256\times 256256 × 256. (††\dagger†) means training on our machine with the same diffusion forward and equivalent architecture.
description: Table 1 presents a comparison of the performance of different generative models on three benchmark datasets: CelebA-HQ, LSUN Church, and FFHQ.  All models were evaluated at a resolution of 256x256 pixels. The table shows key metrics including FID (Fréchet Inception Distance), Recall, and the number of function evaluations (NFEs) required for image generation.  The models compared include various diffusion models and the latent consistency model proposed in the paper, both using one and two sampling steps. This allows for assessing the quality and efficiency of each method across different datasets. The "+†" symbol indicates that a model was trained on the author's machine using the same diffusion forward process and equivalent architecture as the other models for fair comparison.  The goal is to showcase the improved performance of the proposed latent consistency model training technique.

caption: Table 2: Ablation Studies on CelebA-HQ 256×256256256256\times 256256 × 256 dataset at epoch 1400
description: This table presents the results of ablation studies conducted on the CelebA-HQ dataset at 256x256 resolution, after 1400 training epochs. It analyzes the impact of individual components of the proposed training framework on the model's performance, measured by FID (Fréchet Inception Distance) and Recall.  The components evaluated include the choice of loss function (Cauchy, Pseudo-Huber, etc.), the inclusion of diffusion loss at early timesteps, optimal transport (OT) matching, an adaptive scaling schedule for the robustness parameter 'c', and the use of Non-scaling Layer Normalization (NsLN).  The table helps determine the effectiveness of each component in improving the model's image generation quality.
